newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Nov 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Nov 8.

text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company
NEW SEX SCANDAL ROCKS US ARMY
One US army captain and two drill sergeants have been arrested over allegations of rape and sexual harassment of women recruits at the Army Ordnance Centre, Maryland.
DOLLAR CLAWS BACK AFTER YEN BATTERING

The sharp fall in the dollar-yen rate yesterday, caused by comments by Japanese finance ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara that the government was not considering leading the yen lower, began to reverse overnight.

A row has broken out over star underwriter Simon Spinney's decision to leave Brockbank for American-backed Duncanson & Holt Syndicate Management. Various agencies who had introduced Names to Brockbank because of Spinney's performance are angry because they had already made their investment plans for 1997.
REUTERS JOINS THE BATTLE OF THE INDICES

Reuters is to launch a share-tracking service of the top 150 companies listed on the London Stock Exchange, to compete with the FT-SE 100 and Dow Jones' Dow UK. While FT-SE now demands up to 100,000 pounds stg for its service, Dow Jones charges less than 5,000 pounds stg and the Reuters service will be free.
BUFFETT PUTS NEW LIFE INTO SALOMONS

Salomon Brothers' shares have been recovering from the 10 percent sell-off following its worrying recent profits report after their major shareholder Berkshire Hathaway, which is controlled by Nebraska billionaire Warren Buffett, confirmed that it would convert 140m dollars of preferred Salomon shares into common stock.
